AccessibilityState.description:
Accessibility state flags for a node.

These flags represent the current interactive state of an element.
Boolean flags use tri-state logic: True, False, or None (not applicable).

is_hidden.description: Element is hidden from accessibility tree
is_hidden.title: Is Hidden

AccessibilityState.title: AccessibilityState

AccessibilityBounds.description:
Bounding rectangle for an accessibility node.

Coordinates are in screen pixels, typically absolute screen coordinates.
AccessibilityBounds.title: AccessibilityBounds

AccessibilityBounds.description:
Bounding rectangle for an accessibility node.

Coordinates are in screen pixels, typically absolute screen coordinates.
AccessibilityBounds.title: AccessibilityBounds

AccessibilityNode.description:
A node in the accessibility tree.

Each node represents an element in the accessibility hierarchy with
its role, name, value, state, and bounds. The ref field provides a
stable identifier for AI-driven automation (e.g., @e1, @e2).

Example:
    A button might have:
    - ref: "@e5"
    - role: AccessibilityRole.BUTTON
    - name: "Submit"
    - is_interactive: True

ref.description: Reference ID like @e1, @e2 for AI interaction
ref.title: Ref

class_name.description: CSS class name or control class
class_name.title: Class Name

AccessibilityNode.title: AccessibilityNode

AccessibilityRole.description:
ARIA/UIA accessibility roles.

Based on WAI-ARIA 1.2 roles with extensions for Windows UI Automation
and other platform-specific accessibility APIs.
AccessibilityRole.title: AccessibilityRole

Accessibility state flags for a node.

These flags represent the current interactive state of an element.
Boolean flags use tri-state logic: True, False, or None (not applicable).

is_hidden.description: Element is hidden from accessibility tree
is_hidden.title: Is Hidden

AccessibilityState.title: AccessibilityState

AccessibilityBackend.description:
Accessibility capture backend types.

AUTO: Automatically detect the best available backend.
CDP: Chrome DevTools Protocol (browsers, Electron, Tauri on Windows).
UIA: Windows UI Automation (native Windows apps).
ATSPI: AT-SPI2 (Linux desktop accessibility).
AX: macOS Accessibility API.
NONE: No accessibility capture (disabled).
AccessibilityBackend.title: AccessibilityBackend

Bounding rectangle for an accessibility node.

Coordinates are in screen pixels, typically absolute screen coordinates.
AccessibilityBounds.title: AccessibilityBounds

AccessibilityState.title: AccessibilityState

AccessibilitySnapshot.description:
Complete accessibility tree snapshot.

Represents the full accessibility tree at a point in time, with
metadata about the capture source and statistics.

Example AI context output:
    ## Accessibility Tree
    URL: https://example.com/login
    Title: Login Page

    ### Interactive Elements
    - @e1: button "Sign In"
    - @e2: textbox "Email"
    - @e3: textbox "Password"

root.description: Root node of the accessibility tree

total_nodes.description: Total number of nodes in tree
total_nodes.title: Total Nodes

AccessibilitySnapshot.title: AccessibilitySnapshot

AccessibilityRole.description:
ARIA/UIA accessibility roles.

Based on WAI-ARIA 1.2 roles with extensions for Windows UI Automation
and other platform-specific accessibility APIs.
AccessibilityRole.title: AccessibilityRole

AccessibilitySelector.description:
Selector for finding nodes in an accessibility tree.

Provides flexible matching criteria for locating elements by role,
name, automation ID, or other attributes. Multiple criteria are
combined with AND logic.

Example:
    # Find a button named "Submit"
    selector = AccessibilitySelector(
        role=AccessibilityRole.BUTTON,
        name="Submit"
    )

    # Find any textbox containing "email" (case-insensitive)
    selector = AccessibilitySelector(
        role=AccessibilityRole.TEXTBOX,
        name_contains="email",
        case_sensitive=False
    )
AccessibilitySelector.title: AccessibilitySelector

AccessibilityState.description:
Accessibility state flags for a node.

These flags represent the current interactive state of an element.
Boolean flags use tri-state logic: True, False, or None (not applicable).

is_hidden.description: Element is hidden from accessibility tree
is_hidden.title: Is Hidden

AccessibilityState.title: AccessibilityState

AccessibilityBackend.description:
Accessibility capture backend types.

AUTO: Automatically detect the best available backend.
CDP: Chrome DevTools Protocol (browsers, Electron, Tauri on Windows).
UIA: Windows UI Automation (native Windows apps).
ATSPI: AT-SPI2 (Linux desktop accessibility).
AX: macOS Accessibility API.
NONE: No accessibility capture (disabled).
AccessibilityBackend.title: AccessibilityBackend

AccessibilityConfig.description:
Configuration for accessibility capture.

Controls how accessibility trees are captured, including which backend
to use and filtering options.

backend.description: Accessibility backend to use (auto, cdp, uia, etc.)

interactive_only.description: Only capture interactive elements (reduces tree size)
interactive_only.title: Interactive Only

max_depth.description: Maximum tree depth to capture (None for unlimited)
max_depth.title: Max Depth

cdp_host.description: CDP WebSocket host for browser connections
cdp_host.title: Cdp Host

cdp_port.description: CDP WebSocket port for browser connections
cdp_port.title: Cdp Port

cdp_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for CDP operations
cdp_timeout.title: Cdp Timeout

include_bounds.description: Include bounding rectangles for each node
include_bounds.title: Include Bounds

include_value.description: Include current values for input elements
include_value.title: Include Value

AccessibilityConfig.title: AccessibilityConfig

AccessibilityCaptureOptions.description:
Options for a single accessibility capture operation.

Used when invoking a capture to specify target and overrides.

target.description: Capture target: 'auto', 'web', 'native', 'tauri', or a window title/handle
target.title: Target

include_screenshot.description: Also capture a screenshot alongside the tree
include_screenshot.title: Include Screenshot

AccessibilityCaptureOptions.title: AccessibilityCaptureOptions

AccessibilityActionResult.description:
Result of an accessibility-based action.

Returned when performing actions like click_by_ref or type_by_ref.

ref.description: The ref that was acted upon
ref.title: Ref

element_name.description: Name of the element acted upon
element_name.title: Element Name

element_role.description: Role of the element acted upon
element_role.title: Element Role

AccessibilityActionResult.title: AccessibilityActionResult
